author: geekship
title: SOIL: Semantic E-Commerce
description: 对相关产品进行归类和搜索是很难的。

f6_assessments.q0: As the proposer has stated, they did not get time to complete the proposal, this is just an idea and they are reaching out to people. In future please withdraw your proposal if you cannot complete to not waste limited CA/vCA resources in responding and ranking and voter time in voting.
f6_assessments.q1: As the proposer has stated, they did not get time to complete the proposal, thus there is no plan which could be delivered.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no deliverables against which progress can be measured or metrics/goals which can be used to measure success.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal wans to create a an AI-powered search engine on commercial platforms. In my experience, such a service could make things easier to find if implemented in a large market. It is not so clear where it would make a difference with current search engines who also already deploy AI to assist with searches. Furthermore, there is no explanation of what SOIL is the abbreviation for. So a this moment the only novelty presented is tokenising the searches and linking that with product ownership.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has experience in software development, but not AI. Who would develop the AI part and how exactly would AI get integrated in this project? Currently it is a bit too vague to determine if it would work. In addition, the requested 42 USD is unrealistically low to develop this. Shouldn't it rather be 42K USD?
f6_assessments.q2: There isn't a great deal of information to go on. The plan is very short and provides no clarity on the development roadmap, how many customers you're aiming to serve in accordance with time (KPI), how the funds would be used and where in the general plan of the 8 draft-strong project this proposal is situated. Some more information on how the token would be used in more detail would be most welcome as well. The proposal would have a significant higher chance if this were to be included.

f6_assessments.q0:
This very short proposal of 240 words related to the SOIL ecosystem and some AI integration (not clear at all), the proposer states in the proposal that he preferred to focus on another proposal... Moreover the $42 requested seem to be just a placeholder amount.
The proposer posted similar proposal in different funds with almost the same texts, so my reviews will be very similar.
As this is just an unwithdrawn draft, I can only give it 1 star.
f6_assessments.q1:
A LinkedIn profile is given with developer experience but for a developer, a GitHub profile with some code to review is usually better.
Since there is actually an external profile with some experience to review I can give 2 star instead of just 1 but there are no other data in the proposal to match this experience against.
f6_assessments.q2: The outline of a plan is given but doesn't go into any actual details.

f6_assessments.q0: I get the point of the proposal that it wants to build an AI search engine on the SOIL platform, but as the proposer stated, it just made this proposal to reach out and gain interest for his other proposal. Nonetheless, the proposal fits within the challenge although I miss the explanation of how the search engine would use AI?
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the team of this proposal, he is a software engineer which to my knowledge has no understanding of AI. Since the proposer does not state that he needs a team member for this, who is going to develop this project? We are also missing a roadmap. As for the budget how do you plan on doing this with $42?
f6_assessments.q2: As stated in the above rationale we have no roadmap provided by the proposer. How will this project come to life? What is the end date of this? The bigger picture is clear on the proposal but we are missing too much information to assess the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal outlines that the SOIL ecosystem that has been proposed but not funded in other challenges can integrate AI to help categorise and innovate products. The BIT token is a form of basic income token looking to experiment on the implications of a constant income to people within the Cardano ecosystem and mentions the usage of identity such as Atala PRISM.

It is difficult to gage whether the original proposal will make meaningful impact and moving on from that it is also difficult to understand it's implications with e-commerce and SingularityNET in the short and medium term. At present it appears that to make this judgement the SOIL ecosystem should be further developed so it is easier to determine the impact of the original project and then the following impact on this proposal specifically. The idea is overall very interesting however simply needs a lot more refining and information for it to be clearly assessed.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer adds their LinkedIn profile and links to other proposals they have submitted. Further evidence of implementation would be needed to really understand whether it is feasible that the proposer can execute against this proposal or even the original proposal. The budget is very low and reflects that this proposal was more of a template rather than a finished proposal. As such I believe it is fair to disagree that this proposal would be feasible given the low budget and sources provided on how it will be executed.
f6_assessments.q2: A big picture roadmap is given however no success objectives or KPIs are provided. The project needs to be more clearly defined to add to the clarity and once that is done a better understanding of the core BIT token and SOIL ecosystem is needed along with why this specific proposal will be impactful in that ecosystem and the metrics that are important to measure against.

solution: SOIL生态系统利用众包和人工智能对产品进行分类和创新。
experience:
